newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norway share index falls but bank stocks soar.
newsitem.headline: Norway share index falls but bank stocks soar.

text.p: The Norwegian all-share index fell with overseas markets on Monday in reaction to Wall Street, but the bank index rose on the latest twist in the country's financial-sector restructuring saga.
"I think the Norwegian market held its position rather well compared to foreign markets," one broker said. "But I am very uncertain what will happen next."
A wave of U.S. data and earnings figures is due this week.
Oslo's Total index closed 0.69 percent lower at 1,055.95 points in moderate turnover of 986 million crowns, half of it in Fokus Bank, Norway's third largest commercial bank.
Blue chip stock fell but shares in Fokus closed six crowns, or 8.76 percent, higher at 74.50 crowns following a hostile takeover bid by Sparebankgruppen, a group of 16 savings banks.
"There was focus on Fokus," one broker said. "I think the share will drop to 73 crowns because it is too expensive as it stands now."

Sparebankgruppen said it was bidding 73 crowns per share for Fokus, which moved forward the date for its first-quarter result announcement to Tuesday April 15 from April 25 because of the takeover bid.
